abstract.p: Wisconsin Public Service Corp begins reinforcing section of its power grid with five energy storage units employing superconducting magnets, first commercial use of superconductivity in public power distribution; devices were manufactured by American Superconductor (S)

block.p: The Wisconsin Public Service Corporation yesterday began reinforcing a section of its power grid with five energy storage units employing superconducting magnets, the first commercial use of superconductivity in public power distribution. The devices, manufactured by American Superconductor of Westborough, Mass., will be protecting the region around Wausau and Eagle River from voltage spikes and dips as well as blackouts and should increase the capacity of that portion of the grid by 15 percent, according to American Superconductor.

The Wisconsin Public Service Corporation yesterday began reinforcing a section of its power grid with five energy storage units employing superconducting magnets, the first commercial use of superconductivity in public power distribution. The devices, manufactured by American Superconductor of Westborough, Mass., will be protecting the region around Wausau and Eagle River from voltage spikes and dips as well as blackouts and should increase the capacity of that portion of the grid by 15 percent, according to American Superconductor.
